snippet: The United States has relaxed some restrictions on going there, but letting carriers set up regular flights is another matter.
abstract: New rules unveiled by the Obama administration remove many restrictions on travel to Cuba, but commercial airliners are still unlikely to begin regular flights to country for at least another year; direct flights will require Cuba and the United States to negotiate a new air service agreement, process that could be stymied by Congressional opposition and the 2016 presidential election.
lead_paragraph: The United States has relaxed some restrictions on going there, but letting carriers set up regular flights is another matter.

headline.main: Travel to Cuba Eases, but Airlines Will Miss Initial Rush
headline.print_headline: Airlines Will Miss Initial Rush to Cuba
